result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Schiesel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $100 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.  Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity. No contact with G. or M. Buchholtz directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

Outstanding Court Costs in the amount of $343.00 reimposed to the extent not previously paid.    Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Attachment to warrant-60 days or PIF $1331.00
Financial Statment for Failure to Pay
Court finds contempt-60 days in WC Jail-stayed. Must pay $100/month starting Aug 1, 2016 and each month until PIF

14CF-32 and 14CM-125 - Both Cases Called @ 2:28 PM: Defendant Jeffrey A Schiesel in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  No corrections or material errors brought forth.  Chapter 950 in compliance.  Court again reviews VIS.  Counsel stipulate to 60 days TS credit.  Argument by DA - concurs with DOC's recommendation.  Argument by SPD - argues for lesser Co Jail.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  14CF-32 - Ct 1 imposes 5 mos WCJ.  14CM-125 Ct 1 - 5 mos WCJ or 150 days.  Ct 2 - 90 days WCJ. All sentences concurrent to one another with 60 Days TS credit.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.  Any unfilled financial obligations to be paid w/in 60 days or PP.  GT and Huber.  Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 08-07-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Jeffrey A Schiesel in court.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 14CF32 - Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Possession of an Illegally Obtained Prescription contrary to Wis Stat 450.11(7)(h). Plea: 14CF32 - NC. 14CM125 - Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 14FO48, 14FO49, 14TR491 & 14TR492 - DRI. Statement by defendant. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA, Abs Sob, Not be on the premises of any bars, Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity, NC w/ G. or M. Buchholtz, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2014 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey A Schiesel
Current: 1050 County Rd QQ-Apt 15, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States  (Effective: 04-28-2014)
Prior: 415 Main St; Bladers Wild Rose Inn, Wild Rose, WI 54984
Status conference on May 13, 2014 at 10:25 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2014 at 10:45 am.

CASH BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS.  2014CF000032 AND 2014CM000125:  Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.    Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.

records.addlTxt: All Cases Called @ 2:47 PM:  Defendant Jeffrey A Schiesel in court.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to speak with DA on his own regarding all matters before deciding on counsel issue.  14CF-32:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def confirms he does not wish counsel today.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of 20 days time limit for pre-lim hearing.  14CM-125:    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def confirms waiver of counsel today.  NGP entered as to both counsel and companion civil citations as to 14CM-125.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 10:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 10:25 am.
